chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Makayla Shauntel Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Makayla Shauntel Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Makayla Shauntel Johnson was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Makayla Shauntel Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Makayla Shauntel Johnson was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 16 days, if revoked.
Court will not grant expungment hearing at this time.  Deft may petition the Court for reconsideration in 3 years by writing a letter to the Court.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with Jade M, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makayla Shauntel Johnson

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
of DNA Collection at Conviction

09:10 AM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Makayla Shauntel Johnson, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF316/22FO165. Matter is resolved. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2, 3 and 4; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 and 5 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard.   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions. No contact with J.M.. 16 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, DNA surcharge and Drug surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court..  Appeal rights given. Court will not grant expungement hearing at this time - defendant may petition the Court for reconsideration in 3 years by writting a letter to the Court.

Minutes:  9:17am.  22CF316/22FO165.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Michael Barth.  Deft/defense counsel has no objection to Judge Gabriele handling the case.  Defense counsel reports the case is resolved; requests plea date.  JS date changed to a plea hrg - time remains the same.  FO file is trailing.
re: Judicial rotation
Scheduling Order
Br 3 notified of sched order

Defendant, Makayla Shauntel Johnson, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

125PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Mike Barth.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on  May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Bond continued.  sg
Atty Michael Barth
$1000 deposited on 3/27/22

Defendant Makayla Shauntel Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Deft is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agree to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Jade M., Ronald M., Adam M., Pamela M. and KSD Dep. Kless - except in a professional capacity
